abstract: Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Stanley Fischer is optimistic that inflation will rise to appropriate level as American economy grows; remarks at Kansas City conference are seen as another signal that Fed will raise interest rates in September, despite concerns about recent market volatility.
lead_paragraph: The remarks of the Federal Reserve’s vice chairman were highly anticipated after days of turmoil in financial markets that raised questions about whether the Fed’s plans had changed.

headline.main: Optimistic About Inflation, Stanley Fischer Suggests That Fed Will Stick to Plan on Rates
headline.print_headline: Optimistic About Inflation, Fischer Suggests That Fed Will Stick to Plan on Rates

snippet: The remarks of the Federal Reserve’s vice chairman were highly anticipated after days of turmoil in financial markets that raised questions about whether the Fed’s plans had changed.
